result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Rivera Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  No contact with wife in any way.  No contact with daughter unless approved by agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including anger management and cognitive thinking.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with Family Court and child support orders.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jonathan Rivera Gonzalez in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.   Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Defense requests bond modification. 
State objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  No contact with the victim, MMS (person, property, residence or family).  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
